main event: Numerous unidentified objects appeared on radar scopes at McGhee Tyson Airport in Knoxville, Tennessee, on 29 and 30 November 1950.
interesting points: The objects were tracked for an estimated period of two hours on radar, traveling between 45 and 150 miles per hour at altitudes of 2000 to 3000 feet., The radar crew could not lock on and hold the objects, losing them several times., There were no confirmed sightings of these objects from ground observers, despite radar tracking., The unidentified targets were reported to fluctuate in intensity and were described as unaccounted for and unknown., The weather at the time of reports was clear with a southwest wind, which may have contributed to radar anomalies.
witness description: Radar personnel and controllers from the McGhee Tyson Airport, as well as representatives from CIC and OSI.
